question: Can I apply to change his surname to mine?
scenario: I am a guardian to a 16year old teenage boy from syria whom i cared for when he was young and homeless. I want to change his surname to to mine.
gold_answers: You’ll need to get the consent of everyone who has parental responsibility for the child before you make some important decisions, for example:
If you cannot get consent, you can ask the court to decide. Use the form ‘Make an application in existing court proceedings related to children’ (form C2).

question: Can I claim off the government for damage caused by the vaccine?
scenario: As a vulnerable adult I received the Covid-19 vaccination in January 2021. Almost immediately I started to feel very unwell, and over the next few weeks the left side of my face became paralysed, almost like I had had a stroke. I am now unable to talk properly.
gold_answers: Disablement is worked out as a percentage, and ‘severe disablement’ means at least 60% disabled.

question: Will I pay capital gains tax if I sell my current home in order to move into an inherited property?
scenario: I recently inherited my childhood home in Sussex following the death of my father. For sentimental reasons, and because it is bigger than my current home, I would like to move into it with my family. This would mean either selling or renting out my current home. I know that you don't have to pay capital gains tax when you sell your own home, but I'm not clear whether my current home would be classed as my main home if I move into the other property.

question: Can my partner take leave from work due to my stillbirth even though he is not the biological parent of the child?
scenario: I work for a large company as an employee and I have recently experienced a stillbirth at 30 weeks pregnant. I would like my live in partner to have some leave to support me.

question: Are adoptive parents entitled to bereavement leave?
scenario: My husband and I were in the process of adopting our would-be daughter, who was placed with us pending the adoption order. Tragically, we lost her in a traffic accident. We are devastated by her loss and will find it incredibly difficult to carry on working at this time.

question: Is there a way he can be compensated for the damages  after this unfortunate episode?
scenario: My uncle has  developed a serious blood clot after getting his first dose of covid vaccine which has left him severed paralysed and disabled.
gold_answers: Disablement is worked out as a percentage, and ‘severe disablement’ means at least 60% disabled.

question: Do I have to pay inheritance tax on my windfall?
scenario: I inherited forty thousand pounds from my late father. I also have savings of around the same amount. I am currently out of work.
gold_answers: The estate of the person who died usually pays Inheritance Tax. You may need to pay Inheritance Tax if the estate can’t or doesn’t pay it.
You may have to pay Inheritance Tax on money and shares you inherit if the deceased person’s estate can’t or doesn’t pay.

question: Can I continue to claim Housing Benefit?
scenario: I'm 71, and am currently living in rented accommodation with my 64-year-old Civil Partner. I have an existing Housing Benefit claim.

question: Can my sister and I over-rule our other sister and fellow EPA attorney to do what we believe is in our brother's best interests?
scenario: My two sisters and I all hold enduring power of attorney for our brother, who has disabilities which cause him to lack mental capacity to make his own decisions. The EPA was registered in 2006. As his illness has progressed, it's no longer practical for him to receive care in the home and two of us believe that it is in his best interests for him to move into a residential care home. This has financial implications for him as he would have to partly self-fund the care from the sale of his current home. The other sibling disagrees and wants him to remain at home.
gold_answers: You must still involve the person in making decisions whenever possible and only make decisions on their behalf which are in their best interests.
If there’s more than one attorney, check whether you must make decisions:
• separately or together (sometimes called ‘jointly and severally’), which means you can make decisions on your own or with other attorneys
• together (sometimes called ‘jointly’), which means you and all the other attorneys have to agree on a decision
Attorneys who are appointed jointly must all agree or they cannot make the decision.

question: As his special guardian, can I take my nephew with us to live in Boston for a year?
scenario: My 10 year old nephew has been living with us for the last two years, since his parents are unable to care for him due to addiction problems. We would like to look after him long-term and have been advised to apply to be a special guardian. However, I have been offered the chance to take a year's sabbatical from my career in order to join an academic program in the US, so we are considering letting our home and moving to Boston for a year.
gold_answers: You’ll need to get the consent of everyone who has parental responsibility for the child before you make some important decisions, for example:
• taking the child abroad for more than 3 months
If you cannot get consent, you can ask the court to decide. Use the form ‘Make an application in existing court proceedings related to children’ (form C2).

question: Am I eligible for Gift Aid?

gold_answers: You must be recognised as a charity or CASC for tax purposes.
• have paid at least as much in Income Tax or Capital Gains Tax in that tax year as you want to claim in Gift Aid
• make a Gift Aid declaration that gives you permission to claim it
• that are a payment for goods or services or made because your charity or CASC bought goods and services
• where the donor gets a ‘benefit’ over a certain limit
• from charity cards or of vouchers, for example Charities Aid Foundation (CAF) vouchers

• make a Gift Aid declaration that gives you permission to claim it
You must be recognised as a charity or CASC for tax purposes.
• has paid the same amount or more in Income Tax or Capital Gains Tax in that tax year

gold_answers: HMRC will close your PAYE scheme if you’re a new employer and you do not send a report to or pay HMRC in 120 days.

question: can we register as a community amateur sports club ?
scenario: we have a community sports club that targets the youth in our community. we charge a small weekly fee for upkeep.
gold_answers: • be set up with a formal constitution, known as a governing document

CASCs must be open to people of all ethnicities, nationalities, sexual orientations, religions or beliefs, sexes, ages and ability - except when a certain level of physical ability is needed to take part in a sport.
• not make a profit, unless this is reinvested in the club and spent only on promoting participation and providing facilities for eligible sports
• not pay more than £10,000 in total to all players in a year (before 1 April 2015 CASCs couldn’t pay players at all)
• provide only the benefits normally associated with an amateur sports club, eg use of equipment, coaching, post-match refreshments
• only pay expenses for matches and tours where players take part in and promote the club’s sport (before 1 April 2015 clubs couldn’t pay any expenses)

question: can my son get residential support for his studies in London ?
scenario: my son has been accepted at a college that is in London. we are too far away from London for him to commute daily and he needs housing there.
gold_answers: • be at least 16 and under 19 on 31 August 2021
• meet the residency requirements (your college will check this)
• have a household income of less than £30,993
• be studying your first level 2 or level 3 qualification (for example 2 or more A levels, a diploma or a national vocational qualification)
• continuing on a course you started aged 16 to 18
• have an education, health and care plan (EHCP)
• be full-time at a college in England
• be ‘16 to 19 funded’ (your college can confirm this)
Your course must also be more than either 15 miles or a 2 hour round trip from your home, and not available any closer than that.

question: Can I export the car to Japan?
scenario: I am moving to Japan and have an old car that is a family heirloom. It has was my grandfather's car and I have no other family in the UK. I want to keep the car to remember my grandfather. The car also has a personalized registration.

question: Can I make a part 1 claim for agricultural land?
scenario: My agricultural land has become polluted due to the new road built next to it, where lots of heavy lorries drive past each day.
gold_answers: The value of your property must have gone down by more than £50 as the result of specific types of pollution or disturbance from the use of a new or altered road.

question: Do I have a right to compensation?
scenario: A road next to my property has recently been expanded and many heavy trucks are now using the rout. I'm not happy as i have asthma and it's affecting my health.
gold_answers: You can claim after a road’s been open to traffic for 1 year.
The value of your property must have gone down by more than £50 as the result of specific types of pollution or disturbance from the use of a new or altered road.
• the property’s leasehold, with at least 3 years left to run on your lease on the date you make your claim

question: Will I have to pay duty and VAT on goods that cost around £150?
scenario: I have a small business importing wine from France to sell in the London area.

question: Can I use a grant to restore my dissolved company?
scenario: During the pandemic I owned a small company based in Birmingham that dissolved due to bankruptcy. I have started up another company based in Scotland.

question: Can I claim for my brothers business to be restored?
scenario: My brothers business based in London has recently dissolved and he does not want to claim any assets previously owned by the business. I have just claimed my pension.
gold_answers: • they owed you money when they were dissolved
• you’re responsible for their employee pension fund
• you have a shared or competing interest in land
• you were a shareholder or director when it was dissolved
You may be able to restore the company without a court order if you were a director or shareholder of a dissolved company.

question: Will I still have to pay Excise Duty even though the cigarettes will be a gift?
scenario: I live in England, and a friend wants to send me a ten-pack of cigarettes that we used to smoke together when we lived in Barcelona together. My friend still lives in Barcelona.

question: Do I need to pay Customs duty on both the price for the goods and the price of the postage and packaging?
scenario: I live in Bristol. I recently bought a handmade rug online worth £300 from Turkey. It is being sent to me directly from Turkey.

question: Is it possible for me to buy my sister's in law's equipment once her company is formally liquidised?
scenario: My sister in law's cake decorating business has just gone into liquidation as she was no longer able to meet her overheads. She has a lot of professional baking equipment which is tied up in her business.

question: Could I get in trouble if I were to operate without a planning permission?
scenario: I own a computer hardware repair shop which has been doing really well recently. I am interested in expanding my business and opening a new location on the other side of town. I have found the perfect spot in terms of location but the building standing there right now is really old and not well maintained. My plan is to completely demolish it and rebuild it as a place where I can open my shop and also have a few apartments to rent out.

question: Do I still have to pay my tax bill to HMRC?
scenario: I had a limited company and because of the recent IR35 changes I moved to a permanent role but have not liquidated the company and no profits from the company as well

question: Can I opt out of VAT?
scenario: I am a 54 year old who owns a company in Newcastle, my taxable turnover is around £76,000 each year down from £120,000 5 years ago.

question: Does this make me exempt?
scenario: I am a 53 year old from Essex, I have recently liquidised a lot of my business which takes me above the VAT threshold for this tax year. I expect a VAT turnover of £50,000 per annum.
gold_answers: Write to HMRC with evidence showing why you believe your VAT taxable turnover will not go over the deregistration threshold of £83,000 in the next 12 months.
HMRC will consider your exception and write confirming if you get one. If not, they’ll register you for VAT.

question: Do sales of zero-rated items count towards the threshold when calculating my turnover for a given twelve month period?
scenario: I live in Kent and run a small retail business selling bicycles and their parts and accessories to the general public. I am not currently VAT registered, but my turnover is approaching the threshold for registration. This figure, however, includes mail order sales to customers outside the UK, which I believe are currently zero-rated in VAT terms.

question: Can I claim back the intellectual property rights to my unremunerated work?
scenario: I am a software developer, and from mid-2017 until earlier this year I worked for a company which has since been dissolved. At the time of dissolution I held shares in the company and was owed three months’ worth of outstanding wages, with the company retaining the intellectual property rights to work I had done during that three month period.

question: Do i need to inform the local council and seek permission?
scenario: I am planning to utilise my garden area to build an extra bedroom for my growing family. I would like to follow the right rules before i start.
gold_answers: There are other projects that might not need planning permission - for example, projects that will have no impact on your neighbours or the environment. If you think this could apply to your project, check with your LPA through your local council.

question: Can we write a statement to the HMRC to detail our case?
scenario: Our family transport limited company was greatly affected in year 2020 -2021 by covid pandemic restrictions .We are unable to timely pay the corperation tax bill due low profits

question: Can i apply for discretionary grant from the crown?
scenario: My limited company was dissolved by my accountant after it ceased trading some 6 months ago.There were funds remaining in my business bank account. The funds were siezed by the crown and i had to borrow money from relatives.The company has no outstanding debts.

question: Will i need to pay custom duty for the gift ?
scenario: My friend Annita has a wedding Anniversary next month and lives  abroad in South Africa. I would like to send her a gift percel from UK.

question: Do i need VAT registration?
scenario: I run a salon business and i collect £ 30,000 per year.My business turn over is less than vatable threshold of �85,000
gold_answers: You must register if you realise that your total VAT taxable turnover is going to be more than £85,000 in the next 30-day period.
You’ll need to register if you only sell goods or services that are exempt from VAT or ‘out of scope’ but you buy goods for more than £85,000 from EU VAT-registered suppliers to use in your business.
If you take over a VAT-registered business
There’s no threshold if neither you nor your business is based in the UK. You must register as soon as you supply any goods and services to the UK (or if you expect to in the next 30 days).

question: Am I eligible to apply for my new loan online?
scenario: I took a year off of studying to travel around the world. I would now like to continue my education and will need a loan to be able to afford to do so. The last time I studied I also took out a loan with from Student Finance England.

question: Is he allowed to charge me again?
scenario: I began my CBT training course a little over a week ago and have driven with my trainer only 2 times so far. Yesterday after our drive he informed me that he will need to stop my CBT course due to lack of knowledge of traffic signs. I understood and he pointed me at good learning materials so I can catch up. When I asked him when I will be able to continue with my CBT course he said that I will have to begin anew and pay the charge again.

question: Am I going to be allowed to drive back home on my moped after receiving my certificate of completion?
scenario: I will be attending my CBT course tomorrow in hopes of finally being able to drive the moped my parent bought me for Christmas. I passed the theory test and full moped test last year. I am aware that the course will take me the whole day and my dad suggested he drops me off together with my moped and I drive back once I have my certificate. We have already equipped the vehicle with L plates.
gold_answers: You can then ride a moped or motorcycle up to 125cc and with a power output of up to 11kW on the road with L plates (L or D plates in Wales).

question: Is it acceptable for the landlord to have done this arbitrarily?
scenario: My family and I are private tenants and have been for over five years in the same place. My landlord has just increased our rent out of the blue and we cannot afford the new rate.
gold_answers: For a periodic tenancy (rolling on a week-by-week or month-by-month basis) your landlord cannot normally increase the rent more than once a year without your agreement.
For a fixed-term tenancy (running for a set period) your landlord can only increase the rent if you agree. If you do not agree, the rent can only be increased when the fixed term ends.
• your landlord must get your permission if they want to increase the rent by more than previously agreed
• the rent increase must be fair and realistic, which means in line with average local rents
For a fixed-term tenancy (running for a set period) your landlord can only increase the rent if you agree. If you do not agree, the rent can only be increased when the fixed term ends.

question: Do i need to apply for a permit or a licence to own it?
scenario: I own a newly built house and I have set up a septic tank since the property is not connected to the main public sewer.It is mainly for domestic purposes from a toilet and kitchen.
gold_answers: As the ‘operator’ of a septic tank or small sewage treatment plant you must check you meet the general binding rules. You must apply for a permit if you do not.
You’ll need a permit if you do not meet the general binding rules.

question: I want to make a complaint against my immigration advisor, can I?
scenario: I am appealing against a decision to deport me on the grounds that I do not have a skilled job here in the UK. I have been here for over ten years from my native Australia and am desperately looking for work but can't find any. The adviser I hired is not helping me at all.
gold_answers: • bad service you received from an adviser registered with OISC
• immigration advice you received from an unregulated person
You usually cannot make a complaint about something that happened more than 12 months ago - OISC will decide whether or not to investigate depending on the situation.

question: Can we continue to claim our state pensions if we are in the US?
scenario: My husband and I are in in our early seventies and are in receipt of a UK state pension. We have been offered the opportunity to live in the US for four months of the year for the next two years.

question: Will that be possible to pay through my overseas bank account?
scenario: I am a UK citizen but I live abroad.I have reached my state pension age . I want my state pension to be paid to the bank account in the country I am living in.

question: Can we request this agreement without directly contacting out employer?
scenario: I am interested in requesting an information and consultation agreement with my employer. I have spoken to the whole office and everyone agrees that we should request this information. The problem is we are scared from being fired unfairly if we request this from out boss directly.

question: As I am technically only a temp, am I eligible for maternity pay of any kind?
scenario: I am a 30 year old agency worker who has been in the same temp job for nine months. I have just found out that I am pregnant. My baby will be due in seven months and I had expected to still be in the same employment at that time

question: Can the agency refuse to pay because the hirer is unhappy with my daughter's work?
scenario: My daughter is fifteen and has recently been signed up to a modelling agency. So far she has had two jobs with them but we have yet to receive any pay. When I called to enquire I was told that pay was 'pending.' I am worried that the agency will refuse to pay because the hirer is unhappy with my daughter's work.

question: I want to make a formal grievance complaint about my supervisor. Can I?
scenario: I am a junior office worker in a large law firm and have been here for eighteen months. I feel that I am being bullied by my immediate supervisor, who encourages other workers to laugh at me too. This is causing me a great deal of distress.
gold_answers: If you’re a worker and you’ve tried solving a problem or concern informally by talking to your manager but you’re not satisfied, you can make a formal grievance complaint in writing.

question: Will I be eligible to claim asylum in the UK?
scenario: I have moved to the UK as a refugee. I want to claim asylum. I have been persecuted in my home country for my political beliefs. I have travelled through the EU countries to come to the UK.
gold_answers: • travelled to the UK through a ‘safe third country’
• have a connection to a safe third country where you could claim asylum

question: Will I be eligible to make a request?
scenario: I am an employee of a company. I am looking to request an information and consultation agreement due to concerns over the employer's finances. The company has 150 employees. The registered office is in London.

question: Can the employer choose not to negotiate?
scenario: I, and 49 other employees, have requested an information and consultation agreement. The company has 70 employees. Our employer has refused to start negotiations.

question: Do I count as an agency worker under these circumstances?
scenario: I have been out of a job for about 6 months now. Since I have had little to no luck finding opportunities myself I contacted a local firm. They advertise the ability to find me a suitable permanent position in a few months. So far working with them has been great.

question: As I am under the age of eighteen am I legally allowed to apply for refugee status as a child?
scenario: I am sixteen and arrived here illegally a month ago. My family were left behind and I am desperate to hear from them. The country I am from is not safe for me to return to.

question: Can I protest this on the grounds that it will take me a long time to get to work now?
scenario: I have been working for a law firm (as a receptionist) for just over a year. I am fortunate to have been working near to my home but my boss has just announced that we are relocating to a town ten miles away.

question: Is there a way he can be compensated for the damages  after this unfortunate episode?
scenario: My uncle has developed a serious blood clot after getting his first dose of covid vaccine which has left him severed paralysed and disabled. My uncle is considered to be severely disabled.

question: Will our account be closed ?
scenario: I started a limited company and employed 5 employees. I registered for the PAYE scheme. We were very busy and I was not able to find time to pay HMRC in the past 5 months.

question: Can we appeal to a housing tribunal over this rent dispute considering we have a shorthold tenancy agreement?
scenario: I rent a room in a house in multiple occupation in Sheffield, England, and have a periodic assured shorthold tenancy agreement with the landlord. Recently, however, he has announced a very large rent increase as part of a "section 13" procedure, to which I and several other tenants in the building strongly object.

question: Is it acceptable for the landlord to have done this arbitrarily?
scenario: My family and I are private tenants and have been for over five years in the same place. My landlord has just increased our rent out of the blue and we cannot afford the new rate. The fixed-term tenancy agreement has two years remaining.

question: Am I going to be allowed to drive back home on my moped after receiving my certificate of completion?
scenario: I will be attending my CBT course tomorrow in hopes of finally being able to drive the moped my parent bought me for Christmas. I passed the theory test and full moped test last year. I am aware that the course will take me the whole day and my dad suggested he drops me off together with my moped and I drive back once I have my certificate. We have already equipped the vehicle with L plates. The moped I will drive is 50cc.

question: I want to make a complaint against my immigration advisor, can I?
scenario: I am appealing against a decision to deport me on the grounds that I do not have a skilled job here in the UK. I have been here for over ten years from my native Australia and am desperately looking for work but can't find any. The adviser I hired is not helping me at all. This deportation decision was made 18 months ago.

question: I want to make a formal grievance complaint about my supervisor. Can I?
scenario: I am a junior office worker in a large law firm and have been here for eighteen months. I feel that I am being bullied by my immediate supervisor, who encourages other workers to laugh at me too. This is causing me a great deal of distress. I tried to resolve the problem by talking to my manager but I am not happy with his response
